title: Welcome to the Podcast
description: An introduction to our podcast and what listeners can expect from future episodes.
notes:
# Welcome

This is our first episode! We discuss the goals of the podcast and introduce the hosts. Join us as we explore fascinating topics each week.

## Highlights
- Introduction to hosts
- What's coming next
- How to listen and subscribe

title: Exploring Modern Web Technologies
description: A deep dive into the latest tools and frameworks shaping web development in 2025.
notes:
# Modern Web Tech

We discuss Next.js, React, Tailwind CSS and more. Industry trends and best practices.

title: Building Design Systems
description: Best practices for creating scalable, maintainable design systems across teams.
notes:
# Design Systems

How to build component libraries and maintain consistency.

title: API Design Best Practices
description: Creating REST and GraphQL APIs that scale and remain easy to use for developers.
notes:
# API Design

REST vs GraphQL, versioning strategies, and documentation.

title: Testing Strategies for Large Projects
description: Unit, integration, and end-to-end testing approaches for modern applications.
notes:
# Testing

Test pyramids, tools, and best practices.

title: Performance Optimization Techniques
description: Strategies for optimizing web application performance and user experience.
notes:
# Performance

Code splitting, lazy loading, caching, and metrics.

title: Security Essentials for Web Apps
description: Essential security practices every web developer should know and implement.
notes:
# Security

CSP, authentication, authorization, and common vulnerabilities.

title: DevOps Basics for Developers
description: Understanding containers, CI/CD, and deployment pipelines from a developer's perspective.
notes:
# DevOps

Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub Actions, and deployment strategies.

title: Contributing to Open Source
description: A guide for developers looking to contribute to open-source projects and communities.
notes:
# Open Source

Finding projects, making pull requests, and building communities.

title: Career Development in Tech
description: Strategies for growing your career as a software engineer and developer.
notes:
# Career

Skill-building, networking, interviews, and leadership.

title: Accessibility in Web Design
description: Building inclusive web experiences that work for everyone, including users with disabilities.
notes:
# Accessibility

WCAG, ARIA, testing tools, and inclusive design principles.

title: UX Research Fundamentals
description: Understanding user needs through research to inform better product and design decisions.
notes:
# UX Research

Interviews, surveys, prototyping, and user testing.

title: Machine Learning for Web Developers
description: Getting started with ML and AI as a web developer: frameworks, models, and use cases.
notes:
# Machine Learning

TensorFlow.js, frameworks, and practical applications.

title: Headless CMS Architecture
description: Exploring headless CMS solutions and how they fit into modern web development workflows.
notes:
# Headless CMS

Strapi, Contentful, Sanity, and when to use them.

title: Static Site Generation Strategies
description: Deep dive into static site generation, JAMstack, and modern deployment workflows.
notes:
# Static Sites

Next.js, 11ty, Hugo, Netlify, and Vercel.

title: Monitoring and Observability
description: Tools and techniques for monitoring applications, debugging issues, and understanding user behavior.
notes:
# Monitoring

Logging, tracing, metrics, and error tracking.

title: Database Optimization and Queries
description: Techniques for optimizing database queries and schemas for performance at scale.
notes:
# Databases

Indexing, query optimization, and normalization.

title: Real-Time Communication in Web Apps
description: WebSockets, Server-Sent Events, and building real-time features into web applications.
notes:
# Real-Time

WebSockets, SSE, polling, and libraries like Socket.io.

title: Mobile-First Web Development
description: Building responsive, performant web applications optimized for mobile devices and networks.
notes:
# Mobile Web

Responsive design, progressive web apps, and performance on slow networks.

title: The Future of Web Development
description: Exploring upcoming technologies and trends that will shape the future of web development.
notes:
# Future

Web3, serverless, edge computing, AI integration, and emerging standards.
